comments.body: This one is used in the type constructor.
Here fix a bug about parse `INTERVAL '111' day` failed issue. FYI @MaxGekk  @cloud-fan
Do we have tests for MAX_DAY + 1 and MAX_DAY, and for MIN_DAY-1 and MIN_DAY?

comments.body:
Should we add a gap between the two line?
Could you show an example of the error message, please. I just wonder is it readable ...

> Should we add a gap between the two line?
> Could you show an example of the error message, please. I just wonder is it readable ...

```
Interval string does not match day-time format of `[+|-]d h`, `INTERVAL [+|-]'[+|-]d h' DAY TO HOUR` when cast to interval day to hour: INTERVAL '1 01:01:01.12345' DAY TO SECOND, set spark.sql.legacy.fromDayTimeString.enabled to true to restore the behavior before Spark 3.0.
```

comments.body: FYI @MaxGekk rename the parameter make it more clear
Could you change the error message, please. It should reflect `startField` and `endField`.

> Could you change the error message, please. It should reflect `startField` and `endField`.

How about current?

The regex
```scala
  private val yearMonthLiteralRegex =
    (s"(?i)^INTERVAL\\s+([+|-])?'$yearMonthPatternString'\\s+YEAR\\s+TO\\s+MONTH$$").r
```
doesn't support other year-month interval types, for instance `INTERVAL MONTH`. @cloud-fan Again, this is a duplicate of SQL parser logic.
@AngersZhuuuu Could you open JIRA ticket for this, please.

> @AngersZhuuuu Could you open JIRA ticket for this, please.

Sure and will work for ths.

        checkStringIntervalType(YM.YEAR, YM.MONTH)
        toYMInterval(year, month, getSign(firstSign, secondSign))

comments.body: Should hours (and other fields) be in some range? See the table from the SQL:2016 If not, please, explain.

Well, it's true that the range of fields such as hour breaks SQL:2016. And other interval related functions such as `make_interval` and `make_ym_interval` have same problem. Further more, MySQL and PostgreSQL have same behavior, following is the example of PG:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2949045/122197365-b0cef180-ceca-11eb-81af-4427dc6e55a2.png)

So, I think we should keep the consistency with other functions first, and launch a discussion for further decision.
By the way, could you give me the link of the SQL:2016 image by adding a new comment?

    micros = Math.addExact(micros, Math.multiplyExact(days, MICROS_PER_DAY))

    micros = Math.addExact(micros, Math.multiplyExact(mins, MICROS_PER_MINUTE))
